key_risks: Supply chain vulnerabilities due to material shortages and geopolitical tensions
Intense competition from larger global foundries like TSMC, Samsung, and Intel
Dependence on U.S. government and defense contracts
Fluctuating financial performance and inconsistent profitability
Environmental and regulatory risks associated with semiconductor manufacturing
controversies: Reliance on government contracts makes the company vulnerable to policy changes
Capital-intensive nature of the industry leading to financial volatility
environmental_issues: Use of hazardous materials in semiconductor manufacturing
Subject to stringent environmental regulations and potential liabilities
social_issues: Ethical and environmental commitments, including a Supplier Code of Conduct
governance_issues: Public listing through a SPAC merger in 2021, raising capital for growth initiatives
